Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of a Chlorogenic Acid–Strontium-Loaded Bioresorbable eStent for Vein Graft Restenosis Prevention

Intervention.evidence: assigned to receive either the SrCA eStent or serve as controls with non-stented vein grafts

Objective.evidence: This study investigates a novel chlorogenic acid–strontium (SrCA)-loaded polycaprolactone bioresorbable eStent designed to address these issues.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the reduction in neointimal thickness at 4 weeks post-implantation.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group assignments.

Result_Outcome.evidence: mean difference = 0.15 mm, 95% CI 0.10 to 0.20; p < 0.01

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were observed in either group.

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by institutional grants.
